FuncDef: This command displays all the WLAN-GW tunnels matching the specified criteria. Unlike the similar command in theshow>router>vprncontext, this command also includes information on tunnels containing ISA-only UEs such as migrant, DSM and l2-wholesale.
CLIs: tunnels [ router <router-name> ] [ remote-ip <ip-address> ] [ local-ip <ip-address> ] [ encapsulation <encap> [ <encap> <...> <(> <up> <to> 3 max <)> ] ] [ qtag1 <qtag> ] [ qtag2 <qtag> ] [ ap-sap <sap-id> ] [ min-num-ue <minimum> ] [ max-num-ue <maximum> ] [ ap-mac-learn-failed { true | false } ] [ get-num-results ] [ addr-family <family> ] [ ue-type <ue-type> [ ue-type <...> <(> <up> <to> 5 max <)> ] ]

ParaDef.Info: The name or ID of the router where the tunnel terminates.
The IPv4 or IPv6 address indicating one, or both, of the tunnel endpoint IP addresses.
The tunnel encapsulation type, for example GRE, L2TP, or VLAN.
The Q-tags specifying the l2-ap-delimiting tags.
The SAP-ID of the l2-ap SAP.
The minimum number of UEs on the tunnel, after applying the UE type filter.
The maximum number of UEs on the tunnel, after applying the UE type filter.
Filters the results to display only tunnels that have learned the AP-MAC (false) or have not learned the AP-MAC (true).
Displays the total number of tunnels at the end of each tunnel record.
Specifies the tunnel s IP family type (IPv4 or IPv6).
Filters the display based on the presence of specified UE types and is used in conjunction with min-num-ue and max-num-ue. Values-migrant, dsm, l2w, esm, or xcon.
